It sounds like cool features, but I think the main focus of ZeroNet should still be to make P2P distributed sites "sexy" and easy to use. Compared to freenet/gnunet ZeroNet is much more user friendly, the tradeoff is that anonymity is not built in. But I think this is one of ZeroNet's strengths, because why re-invent anonymity when we have Tor, vpn or i2p.

Wi-Fi interconnect and ISP "bypass" sounds much like mesh network which there already is several alternatives, if ZeroNet should support this then it would be much smarter just to implement support for one of the mesh networks in a similar way Tor is done.

I would suggest that ZeroNet focuses on it's strengths, and core features, instead of spreading itself too thin with half baked features.
